descriptionSet.description: On this movie poster for the Hindi movie "Mandi", released in 1983, two of the main actors, Shabana Azmi and Saeed Jaffrey can be seen walking together. Saeed Jaffrey is dressed in a topi (cap) and a jacket. Shabana Azmi is wearing a green sari with the pallu draped over her head, a big bindi and is carrying an embroidered bag. Both of them are wearing dark glasses as they walk past a roadside shop selling goods.

description-en: On this movie poster for the Hindi movie "Mandi", released in 1983, two of the main actors, Shabana Azmi and Saeed Jaffrey can be seen walking together. Saeed Jaffrey is dressed in a topi (cap) and a jacket. Shabana Azmi is wearing a green sari with the pallu draped over her head, a big bindi and is carrying an embroidered bag. Both of them are wearing dark glasses as they walk past a roadside shop selling goods. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie: This classic film is based on a classic Urdu short story 'Aanandi' by Pakistani writer Ghulam Abbas. It deals with a brothel at the heart of a city, in an area that some politicians want for its prime locality. They rally up against the brothel and its inhabitants in the name of morality, and soon everyone in the area jumps on the bandwagon. The politicians offer to put up an alternative residence for the prostitutes, only this place is miles away, isolated from the city. The madam of the house has no choice but to comply, but by the end things take a (logical) turn for the better. After all, men will be men. (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0085896/, last accessed 2011-12-25. story line, leading actors, director. (gs)
